entry.title: Habitat
entry.content:
Watch Now

Join us for a discussion about Habitat a new approach to automation that focuses on the application instead of the infrastructure it runs on. With Habitat, the apps you build, deploy, and manage behave consistently in any runtime — metal, VMs, containers, and PaaS. You’ll spend less time on the environment and more time building features.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

entry.title: InSpec
entry.content:
Watch Now

Join us for a discussion about InSpec, the open-source testing framework for infrastructure with a human- and machine-readable language for specifying compliance, security, and policy requirements.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Christoph Hartmann github, twitter
  • Dominik Richter github, twitter
  • Gary Bright github twitter
  • Paul Welch github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

What’s Cooking? - Chef News & Events

  • Webinars:
    • Test Driven Cookbook Development - February 24
    • Chef Workflow - March 9
  • Upcoming Chef Training
    • Chef Essentials
      • San Francisco
      • Atlanta
      • Seattle
      • Boston
      • Hyderabad
      • San Francisco
      • Online
    • Chef Intermediate Topics
      • Atlanta
      • Boston
      • San Francisco
      • Online
    • Test-driven Cookbook Development - New offering
      • Online
  • From the Chef Blog
    • Chef Development Kit 0.11
    • Chef Analytics 1.3.0 Release
    • Server Admins Grant More Flexible Permissions Around User Management
    • Chef Client 12.7 Released
    • Chef Compliance 0.11.1 release
      • Chef Compliance 0.14.5 is now available!
  • From the mailing list - https://discourse.chef.io/
    • New releases of delivery-truck and delivery-sugar
  • New on the supermarket
    • Recent Cookbooks
      • sssd_ad v0.6.0 - installs SSSD on a Ubuntu system and configures it for Active Directory authentication
      • flywaydb v3.0.0 - Installs flywaydb and allows for execution of flyway commands via resource actions.
      • chef_install_configure_collectd v0.1.3 - a set of recipes to install and configure collectd
      • gimp v1.0.1 - installs GIMP
      • netapp_e v1.1.0 - Manages NetApp E-Series storage systems
      • divvy v0.2.1
      • ceph-chef v0.9.8 - Installs/Configures Ceph (Hammer and above)
      • seven_zip v2.0.0 - Installs/Configures the 7-zip file archiver and provides the seven_zip_archive resource
      • sumologic-collector v1.2.4
      • dynatrace v0.1.13 - Installs the Dynatrace Application Monitoring solution.
      • Follow @getgetchef on twitter for more cookbook updates.
    • Recent Tools and Plugins
      • knife-acropolis
      • os-hardening
  • Upcoming Events
    • ChefConf 2016 - July 11-13 in Austin, Texas. CFP and ticket sales are now open.
    • Bucks County Tech Meetup
    • Successful Practices for Continuous Delivery – DevOpsDC Meetup
    • DevOpsDays
      • Vancouver - April 15-16
      • London - April 19-20
      • Rockies/Denver - April 21-22
      • Atlanta - April 26-27
      • Austin - May 2-3
      • Kiel - May 12-13
      • Seattle - May 12-13
      • Toronto - May 26-27
      • Istanbul - June 3
      • Washington, DC - June 8-9
      • Salt Lake City - June 14-15
      • Amsterdam - June 29 - July 1
      • Minneapolis - July 20-21
      • Portland - August 9-10
      • Chicago - August 30-31
      • Dallas - September 15-16
      • New York - September 23-24
      • Detroit - October 11-12

Show Notes

  • InSpec - open-source testing framework for infrastructure with a human- and machine-readable language for specifying compliance, security and policy requirements.
  • Inspec vs Serverspec
  • Why another test framework?
  • Testing
  • Who are the target users of inspec?
  • Security
    • List of InSpec resources
    • When do I use inspec in my infrastructure’s lifecycle?
      • Testkitchen
    • Out of compliance
  • Chef Compliance
  • The inspec command line interface
  • Train - Transport Interface to unify communication over SSH, WinRM, and friends.

Picks

Christoph

  • hardening.io

Dominik

  • InSpec 1.0 - watch for it soon!

Gary

  • Test Driven Cookbook Development - February 24
  • Test Kitchen tutorial

Paul

  • Jrnl
  • Quiver Programmers Notebook
  • Gauntlt Cucumber framework for security

Mike

  • gnu libc vulnerability - CVE-2015-7547
    • CVE-2015-7547: glibc getaddrinfo stack-based buffer overflow
    • Dan Kaminsky’s post, A Skeleton Key of Unknown Strength
  • Crystal programing language

Nathen

  • Take a vacation!

What’s Cooking? - Chef News & Events

    • Chef Essentials
      • Chicago

  • New on LearnChef
    • Transformation at Gannett in the Skills Library
  • New on the supermarket
    • Recent Cookbooks
      • nginx_server v1.0.1
      • docker v2.4.12
      • artifactory-artifact v0.2.0
      • prun-cfg v0.2.25 (PostgreSQL / Ruby on Rails/ Ubuntu / Nginx)
      • telegraf v0.3.3
      • os_floating_lo v0.1.2
      • bacula-backup v1.10.2
      • jetty v0.4.1 - Deprecated
      • sqlite v1.1.3 - Deprecated
      • sensu-handlers v0.1.7
      • Follow @getgetchef on twitter for more cookbook updates.
    • Recent Tools and Plugins
      • Reagan - Ruby Jenkins build script that automates the testing of individual items in a monolithic chef-repo.
      • kitchen-chef-extended-attributes - Kitchen Driver that allows you to use test-kitchen with chef-solo - and automatically link suites to the same named JSON dna file to ensure your node specification doesn’t drift from your test definition.
      • /tmp Compliance Profile - An example compliance profile built with InSpec
      • Rubymine Chef Configs - Rubymine configurations for Chef
  • Upcoming Events
    • ChefConf 2016 - July 11-13 in Austin, Texas. CFP and ticket sales are now open.
    • DevOpsDays
      • Vancouver - April 15-16
      • London - April 19-20
      • Rockies/Denver - April 21-22

      • Amsterdam - June 29 - July 1
      • Minneapolis - July 20-21

Show Notes

  • We should do a @foodfightshow about DevOps & Design Thinking with @jeffsussna; clearly several of us are thinking about it!

  • Design Thinking compared to Lean Concepts, DevOps, and Agile
  • How does it inform the practice of building & operating high velocity organizations?

  • TPS: Toyota Production System
  • A3 Template
    • Developing a Learning Culture: Intro to the Personal A3 Template
  • Abduction
  • Implementation: “What is it you actually want to do?”
  • Design Thinking Workshops
    • Designing Delivery: Rethinking IT in the Digital Service Economy
  • Design Thinking Resources
    • Change by Design: How Design Thinking Transforms Organizations and Inspires Innovation
    • This is Service Design Thinking
    • Japanese Terms For DevOps Practitioners
    • DevOps Demystified

Picks

Jeff Sussna

  • Hippie Modernism: The Struggle for Utopia

Brandon

  • Towards an understanding of technical debt
  • The Principles of Product Development Flow: Second Generation Lean Product Development

Nathen

  • ChefConf

entry.title: Chef and OpenStack
entry.content:
Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • JJ Asghar github, twitter, blog, irc: j2
  • Nick Silkey github, twitter, irc: filler
  • Samuel Cassiba github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

  • Last OpenStack Episode - Episode 61 - Sept, 2013
    • Grizzly to Havana timeframe
    • Nova - Compute
    • Swift - Object Storage
    • Glance - Image Service
    • Keystone - Identity Service
    • Horizon - Dashboard
    • Neutron - Network Service
    • Cinder - Block Storage Service
    • Ceilometer - Metering Service
    • Heat - Orchestration

  • New services since then:

    • Trove - Database as a Service
    • Magnum - Container as a Service
    • Designate - Control Plane for DNS as a Service
    • Ironic - Bare Metal Provisioning
    • https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/

  • Is OpenStack still relevant?

    • State of private cloud implementations? Still relevant?
    • Nobody Knew How Big a Deal the Cloud Would Be—They Do Now

  • OSOps - The OpenStack Operators project - wiki

  • OSOps is a project to help get shared Operators tools, experiences, and workflows in one location; they may range from useful scripts/configs to fully supported tools.
  • OSOps Contribution Tooling - A place for scripts and tools can get pushed up for the greater OpenStack Operator community to use. There are no coding standards here, but every tool is at least visually checked via the core membership for anything that looks malicious. Use at your own risk.

  • OSOps Generic Tooling - A repo of curated tools and scripts. These have been verified that do what they say, pass our coding standards and have been found useful by the Operating Community.

  • Community App Catalog

  • OpenStack with Chef - the OpenStack Chef cookbooks - wiki

    • The OpenStack Chef cookbooks are the result of a collaborative project to provide building blocks for building out OpenStack-based cloud infrastructure.
    • Contributing to the project - how to introduce yourself to the OpenStack Chef cookbooks and the community

Picks

JJ

  • This War of Mine
  • Labyrinth Black Ale
  • Vote for the OpenStack Board, ideally me!

Nick

  • Jenkins Job Builder
  • Munchkin
  • Good Ole make

Samuel

  • Building Microservices
  • Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale
  • bhyve

Nathen

  • Config Management Camp EU - Feb 1-2 in Gent
  • ChefConf 2016 - July in Austin, CFP opens Feb 1
  • Disconnect!

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

entry.title: Learning Reviews
entry.content:
Join us for a discussion of Learning Reviews. What and how can we learn from failure?

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Dave Zwieback twitter, blog, github
  • Caitlin Milligan Sheaffer twitter
  • Lola Soto twitter
  • Christopher Webber github, twitter
  • Yulia Sheynkman about
  • Robb Kidd github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline & Show Notes

  • Beyond Blame: Learning From Failure and Success by Dave Zwieback
  • Learning Reviews vs Performance Reviews and Postmortems
  • Blameless Postmortems
  • The History of the Book and The Postmortems Workshops
  • Lola’s Postmortem Workshop Experience
  • Identifying and Preventing Blame
  • Accountability
  • Prioritization
  • Tradeoffs
  • Understanding Risk
  • Discount Rank (Why is an executive in the room?)
  • Where do you start?
  • Closing Comments
    • Postmortems reveal a lot of opportunities for organizational change. There is ideally a channel for directing this to the right team. (And someone empowered/able to manage that process)
    • Maybe you’d have an executives-only learning review about, say, a recent board meeting
    • Assess the degree of organizational maturity when figuring out how to set up learning reviews for success.
  • Other Resources:
    • A Tough Day as Leaders
    • MINDWEATHER - Follow Dave and learn about upcoming workshops

Picks

Dave

  • Beyond Blame: Learning from Failure and Success

Nathen

  • Food Fight Show 14 - Live Post-Mortem With David Zwieback, John Allspaw, and Mike Rembetsy
  • Community Pulse podcast

Mike

  • Blue Apron
  • Wüsthof Knives

Robb

  • Dave’s new book!
  • Incident Management for Operations by Rob Schnepp, Ron Vidal, and Chris Hawley (in early release at O’Reilly)
  • Not Your Father’s Root Beer by Small Town Brewery

Christopher

  • Silos, Politics, and Turf Wars
  • Enjoy By IPA by Stone Brewing
  • Chef Delivery

Yulia

  • Bone broth
  • Elephant in the Room: How Relationships Make or Break the Success of Leaders and Organizations, Diana MacLane Smith
  • Thanks for the Feedback, Douglas Stone

Caitlin

  • Digital PM Summit from the Bureau of Digital
  • Hamilton, a musical, and the Broadway cast recording on Spotify

Lola

  • The Power of Now, Eckhart Tolle

  • Audio

  • Mukta Aphale github, twitter, TechLinguist
  • Harold “Waldo” Grunenwald twitter, github
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef Conf 2015: Game On! March 31 - April 2 at the Santa Clara Convention Center in Santa Clara, CA.

Day 1: Tuesday, March 31st

  • Workshop - Introduction to Chef: Managing Linux
    • Diversity Scholarship
    • Diversity in the Chef Community
  • Chef Community Summit
    • Open Space Event
  • Welcome Reception Beverages & Snacks provided.
    • 5:30pm - 7:00pm in the Exhibit Hall
  • Chef Meetup @ Ooyala
    • Ooyala

Day 2: Wednesday, April 1st

  • 5K Run
  • Power Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center’s Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Nathen Harvey
    • Barry Crist and Justin Arbukle
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 1)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 2)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 3)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 4)
    • Surprise Speaker!!
  • Track Sessions
    • Brian Scott and Jeff LaPlante: Disney DevOps: Automating the Enterprise with Supermarket, Containers and BI
    • Bridget Kromhout: Cooking Up Drama
    • Jamesha Fisher: Securing the Heart of Automated Infrastructure
    • Matt Wrock: Entering the Chef Ecosystem from a Windows Background
  • Panel: Have Your Bets On Open Paid Off? with Cade Metz
  • Sponsors’ Happy Hour
  • After Party at Levi’s Stadium
  • Game Night

Day 3: Thursday, April 2nd

  • Gentle and Slow Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center’s Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Adam Jacob
    • Jez Humble
    • Nicole Forsgren
  • Track Sessions
    • Jessica DeVita: Automate What You Can, Document What You Can’t and Have the Wisdom to Know the Difference
    • Christine Draper: Serve Meals, Not Ingredients
    • Jon Cowie: [Workflow Design: Extracting Signal from the Noise
    • Harold “Waldo” Grunenwald: Chef Retrospective
    • Mukta Aphale: Baking Docker Using Chef

Other Talks and Information

  • POSHChef
  • PowerShell from the Group Up
  • Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Veteran Chefs
  • Networking SDD: Same Stuff, Different Department

  • Managing Databases with Chef

  • Twitter list of all ChefConf Speakers

  • Awesome Chef Awards

  • Friday Hack Day
    • Mountain View
  • Chef as a Welcoming Community
    • Reaching Out to Community Newbies (Upcoming Program!)
  • Thursday Lightning Talks: DevLOLOps - How To Automate Your DevOps Hilarity
  • Thank You Jennifer Burke!!

entry.content:
A wrap-up of Configuration Management Camp 2015 recorded live at the end of the conference.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio

Panel

  • Kara Sowles - twitter
  • Gareth Rushgrove - twitter
  • James Shubin - twitter
  • Andrew Clay Shafer - twitter
  • Kris Buytaert - twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

  • Panel Intros
  • The Puppet Podcast
  • The Genesis of ConfigManagementCamp
  • 8 Track Conference in Gent, Belgium from February 2-3 2015
  • FOSDEM Conference
  • Differences between this year’s conference and last year’s
  • Life of a Community Manager
  • FOSDEM vs ConfigManagementCamp
  • Monitorama
  • Containerization
  • Virtualization
  • Widespread Maturity
  • Building Images in Docker
  • Tools and Solving Higher Level Problems
  • Controversial Topics:
    • Config management is a solved problem.
    • Talks responding to talks.
    • The future of configuration management.
    • Distributed systems and ways to kill central orchestration.
    • Orchestration is a smell.
    • Dev and Ops hate each other.
  • Chef in Europe
  • Getting good as being a distributed community => Should we do a North American ConfigManagementCamp??
  • Does geography and culture impact adoption?
  • Honesty, sharing, and vulnerability
  • Keep it niche; keep pushing forward W* here does ZooKeeper fit in?
  • Technology Transition

entry.title: Complexity Theory and Cynefin
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss Complexity Theory and Cynefin. This twitter thread is the inspiration for this show.

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Dave Zwieback twitter, blog, github
  • Courtney Nash twitter, github
  • Ben Rockwood twitter, blog, github
  • Dave Snowden twitter, blog

Outline

Chef News

  • Upcoming Chef Training - Register with code FOODFIGHT to save 10%
    • Bangalore - Fundamentals
    • San Francisco - Fundamentals
    • Bangalore - Intermediate
    • London - Intermediate with Nathen! - Feb 5-6
    • NYC - Intermediate
    • NYC - Fundamentals
    • Seattle / Windows
    • San Francisco - Intermediate
    • London - Fundamentals
    • Atlanta - Intermediate
    • Atlanta - Fundamentals
    • Minneapolis - Fundamentals
    • Minneapolis - Intermediate
    • Online
      • Feb 11-13
      • Feb 18-20
      • Feb 24-26
  • Upcoming Conferences & Events
    • FOSDEM
    • Configuration Management Camp
    • Piedmont Triad DevOps Inaugural Meetup
    • Chef Users London Meetup with Nathen! - Feb 4
    • Developer Week San Francisco
    • The Lean Enterprise: Book Signing and Q&A with Jez Humble at the AWS Startup Loft in San Francisco
  • ChefConf
    • March 31 - Community Summit & Training Workshops
    • April 1 & 2 - Keynotes, session tracks, etc.
    • Schedule - Still a bit of a work in progress
    • Register with code FOODFIGHT to save 10%

Show Notes

  • This twitter thread is the inspiration for this show.
  • The HBR Article: David J. Snowden and Mary E. Boone: A Leader’s Framework for Decision Making
  • Cynefin
  • [Ben Rockwood’s Keynote at LISA: The DevOps Transformation
  • Dave Snowden: Beyond Manufacturing Metaphors: Thinking Anew, Acting Anew
  • Complexity Defined: The Complexity Theory
    • Systems
      • Ordered
      • Obvious
      • Complicated
      • Chaotic
  • How do we know which domain (obvious/complicated/complex/chaotic) we’re in, and how does that impact how we might act?
  • Disorder
  • Emergent Coherence
  • Constraints
    • Scientific Management of Systems
  • Six Sigma
  • Consensus and Ritual Decent
  • Efficiency and Effectiveness
  • Requisite Diversity
  • Conceptual Blending
  • Cognitive Nueroscience
  • Applying the theory to day to day activities and teams
  • How do these ideas relate to DevOps, IT Operations, Agile, LEAN, ITIL, etc.?
    • Is the understanding of complex, adaptive systems one of the reasons for the emergence of DevOps?
    • Is DevOps itself a complex, adaptive system (including its pratitioners)?
    • Why manufacturing metaphors may not work in describing IT Operations?
  • Safety => Breaking the Rules, Compliance
  • Testing, Anticipatory Awareness
  • Training

Picks

Mike

  • Snow and the weather

Dave Zwieback

  • Awesome Postmortems Workshop - February 12, 2015, NYC.

Courtney

  • @EskoKilpi

Ben

  • anCnoc 12
  • Go Beyond Cynefin
  • Read Henry Ford’s work and learn, learn, learn!

Dave Snowden

  • Ritual Dissent
  • Penderyn

Nathen

  • St. Baldrick’s Foundation - My son’s St. Baldrick’s team

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

  • A challenge to everyone involved in organising tech events: how can we leverage our many social gatherings for the greater social good? For example, consider the 1:1:1 model in the context of tech events, or even something as simple as donating some of the profits to charity (perhaps to build a well).
